intro: Ptychotis heterophylla subsp. timbalii, commonly known as the Timbalai ptychotis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves that vary in size and shape depending on the environment. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have a yellowish or greenish color with prominent orange or red stamens. This subspecies is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and attractive floral display.
